result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew K Vertz

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Matthew K Vertz in court.  Attorney Carl W Knepel in court for Matthew K Vertz.  Prosecuting attorney Angelina R Scarpelli in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Public defender needs more time to appoint counsel. 
IA reset to 11-21-2022 at 1:30pm
Re:  Keeper of drug house, on 09-27-22.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of keeper of a drug house and bail jumping.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 10-17-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant is to have no contact with Jennifer Norrell, Brandon Tompkins and Joshua Roepke except through legal proceedings to obtain possession of home, defendant is to have no contact with any known drug users or dealers and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
